hero.title: Restoring the Pasig River: From one Marcos to another
hero.description: The problem of the Pasig River endures as Philippine presidents come and go

primary.lead: Eruption of Mount Kanlaon in Negros Province
primary.title: Kanlaon Volcano erupts; Phivolcs raises Alert Level 2
primary.description: Manila, Philippines — The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (Phivolcs) reported a phreatic eruption at Kanlaon Volcano on Monday night reaching 5,000 meters high.

secondary.title: Nearly 800 persons displaced by Kanlaon Volcano eruption
secondary.description: Almost 800 persons have been evacuated following the “explosive eruption” of Kanlaon Volcano in Negros Island on Monday night, the National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) said.

secondary.title: Kanlaon eruption: 2 areas under state of calamity
secondary.description: The city of Canlaon in Negros Oriental and the municipality of La Castellana in Negros Occidental declared a state of calamity on Tuesday, a day after being hit with ashfall and sulphuric fumes as a result of Kanlaon Volcano’s phreatic eruption.

secondary.title: Phivolcs confirms lahar flows from Kanlaon, warns residents
secondary.description: Various parts of communities affected by the eruption of Kanlaon Volcano on June 3, 2024 have been experiencing lahar flows amid the occurrence of localized thunderstorms

carousel.title: Living with Shrinkflation
carousel.description: When prices remain the same, but products are shrinking — what can consumers do to deal?

carousel.title: Why schools no longer have valedictorian and  salutatorian awards
carousel.description: Aside from the school vacation that follows right after, one of the most anticipated events after the end of the school year is the awarding of honors to the top-performing students during a recognition or graduation ceremony.

carousel.title: Floating bamboo houses keep this indigenous tribe safe in a typhoon
carousel.description: The Manobo indigenous community in the Agusan Marshlands of the Philippines live in floating homes able to withstand floods, rising water levels and typhoons.

carousel.title: How the Philippines is turning the water-cannon on China
carousel.description: Ferdinand Marcos’s flip is a huge gift to America. But dangers lie ahead
